title: Kedarnath
description: Located at 3,583 meters, Kedarnath is one of the twelve Jyotirlingas dedicated to Lord Shiva. The journey to this temple is both challenging and rewarding, with stunning views along the trek.

title: Badrinath
description: Dedicated to Lord Vishnu, Badrinath is famous for its ancient temple, situated at an altitude of 3,133 meters. The pristine waters of the Alaknanda River and the backdrop of the Nar and Narayan mountains add to its allure.

title: Gangotri
description: Gangotri is the origin of the Ganges River and holds deep spiritual significance. The temple here is dedicated to Goddess Ganga, and the serene surroundings make it a tranquil spot for reflection and prayer.

title: Yamunotri
description: The starting point of the Yamuna River, Yamunotri is dedicated to Goddess Yamuna. The trek to the temple is picturesque, with hot springs and beautiful landscapes along the way.
